Compared to some of the other stories posted here this is nothing. I was living in Vegas at the time I had just gotten of work on my way home. The news had retorted a heat storm on the way. I stopped by the 7-11 by my house for some snacks. This guy (homeless I presume) asked if I could spare some change. I didn't have any change I could give, so I ask him what he was trying to get. He was honest and said that he was looking to get a beer. His honesty for some reason resonated with me, I told him to give me a moment I went in and got what I needed and picked up two tall boys of bud light (it was 2 for $3) and grabbed two sandwiches.
I gave it to him and wished him a dry weekend. He thanked me with a shocked look on his face. As I headed for my car I heard him say that it was the nicest thing someone had done for him.
I didn't even think it was a big deal (it was $8 at most), but I guess for some the smallest thing counts. I never saw the guy again but I hope he is doing well. But this event stuck with me, it reminds me that I am much better off than a lot of people out there.
That people are happy.
